description: The Nipah virus (NiV), first identified in 1998 during an outbreak in Malaysia and Singapore, is an enveloped, negative-sense non-segmented single-stranded RNA genome with base pairs of 18252 belongs to the family Paramyxoviridae, genus Henipavirus. The animal host reservoir of this zoonotic virus is the fruit bat (genus Pteropus) and its spreading typically requires direct contact with an infected source.
name: Nipah Virus Antibodies and Antigens
